solution_line_template: The cost of her rent and utilities was {rent_utilities_percent_old}*p = 2p/5
Her income was increased by ${salary_increase} so it is now p+${salary_increase}
The cost of her rent and utilities now amount to {rent_utilities_percent_new}*(p+${salary_increase}) = (p+${salary_increase})/4
Equating both expressions for cost of rent and utilities: 2p/5 = (p+${salary_increase})/4
Multiplying both sides of the equation by 20 gives 8p = 5p+${multiplied_value}
Dividing both sides by 3 gives p = ${previous_income}
